intro: Erigeron atticus var. drenowskii, commonly known as the Drenowskii fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage is usually covered in fine, hairy hairs, which help reduce water loss in arid environments.
